subject: Add support for PLDM error logging in message_registry.json.
commitMessage:
Add support for PLDM error logging in message_registry.json.

     - Enables the documented SRC for PLDM PELs in peltool.

Tested with validator - openpower-pels/registry/tools/process_registry.py

Change-Id: I2cd1cd2cbb4535996d77e05caf52cd371fa6fad1
Signed-off-by: Sridevi Ramesh <sridevra@in.ibm.com>

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 8c330e4332292f849109307716005b7ba91bb6fc
could you add more information to the commit message?

You'll notice that all of the other entries in this file have a '.Error.' segment somewhere in the name... I don't think it really matters from a technical point of view, so it's fine for now, may need to revisit in the future if something comes up.

That 'bmc' segment also is maybe unnecessary since the one that proceeds it already mentions bmc.  I suppose that would be a pain to fix in the PLDM code though.

This description field is what is going to go into the official documentation on the IBM web site.  I think it's for the most part supposed to avoid BMCisms.  So maybe something more generic like 'Software failure in the PLDM application" or something along those files, maybe Sampa or Manoj have some ideas.

This goes for the other entries too.

There is an optional 'Notes' field where you can add as much extra information as you'd like.
This isn't PLDM like the others?
Thanks Jay for improvising the desc and message content.
Would be better describe like "Failed to retrieve the requested dump object path from the system."
Please change something to "Failed to notify the dump manager application on the newly created hypervisor dump."
Change something to "Failed to extract the dump offload URI path from the dump entry."
Please change to "The hypervisor has rejected the request to initiate a new resource dump."
Please change to "The reset of the dump id failed and due to this dump won't be deleted from the system as requested."
Please change to "Failed to carry out the dump delete request from the hypervisor."
Please change to "Failed to set the dump offloaded completion flag in the dump entry."
Please change to "Failed to extract the file path of the BMC dump which in turn required to offload the dump to hypervisor."
Please change to "Failed to extract the file path of the BMC dump which is required to offload the dump to hypervisor."
Please change to "Failed to create a new resource dump as hypervisor verification did not get succeeded."
Please change to "Failed to set the dump offloaded completion flag in the dump entry details."
Please change something to "Failed to notify the dump manager application on the newly created hypervisor dump details."
I think what I mentioned is enough for this context.
Please change to ""Failed to send the resource dump parameters for a new dump initiation.""
Please change to "Failed to initiate sending of the certificate or license file to the host".
Please change to "Failed to decode the response of sending the certificate or license file to the host".
Please change to "Failed to send the new certificate or license file to the host".
Please change to "Failed to reset the dump offload URI path from the dump entry.".
Is it repeated as both this and "xyz.openbmc_project.bmc.NewFileAvailableRequestFail" are same ? You may remove this ?

hmm, none of these have callouts.
@Sampa what would you like for that?

this error comes when phyp fails to ping bmc. and phyp might fail to ping us when it is hung or crashed.

so the priority should be high.
Host did not ping bmc until the surveillance timer has been expired, Host is possibly crashed or hung
Host failed to complete the power off operation gracefully within the timeout.
